author: @agensir
title: Papa Francesco: incontro per l’80° delle Acli. Democrazia e “stile cristiano”. “Siate voce di una cultura della pace” - AgenSIR
text: Il Papa ha poi sottolineato la terza caratteristica delle Acli: “uno stile democratico. La fedeltà alla democrazia è da sempre un tratto distintivo delle Acli. Oggi ne abbiamo tanto bisogno. Democratica è quella società in cui c’è davvero un posto per tutti, nella realtà dei fatti e non solo nelle dichiarazioni e sulla carta. Per questo è importante il molto lavoro che fate soprattutto per sostenere chi rischia l’emarginazione: i giovani, ai quali in particolare destinate le iniziative di formazione professionale; le donne, che spesso continuano a patire forme di discriminazione e disuguaglianza; i lavoratori più fragili e i migranti, che nelle Acli trovano qualcuno capace di aiutarli a ottenere il rispetto dei propri diritti; e infine gli anziani e i pensionati, che troppo facilmente si ritrovano ‘scartati’ dalla società, e questa è un’ingiustizia. A queste persone prestate un servizio importante, che non deve soltanto restare nell’ambito dell’assistenza, ma promuovere la dignità di ogni persona e la possibilità che ciascuno possa mettere in campo le proprie risorse e il proprio contributo”. Quarto: uno stile pacifico, “cioè da operatori di pace. In un mondo insanguinato da tante guerre, so di condividere con voi l’impegno e la preghiera per la pace. Per questo vi dico: le Acli siano voce di una cultura della pace, uno spazio in cui affermare che la guerra non è mai inevitabile mentre la pace è sempre possibile”. Infine, “uno stile cristiano. Lo menziono per ultimo non come un’appendice, ma perché si tratta della sintesi e della radice degli altri aspetti di cui abbiamo parlato. A chi possiamo guardare per capire che cosa vuol dire essere operatori di pace fino in fondo, se non al Signore Gesù? Dove possiamo trovare ispirazione e forza per accogliere tutti, se non nella vita di Gesù? Assumere uno stile cristiano, allora, vuol dire non soltanto prevedere che nei nostri incontri ci sia un momento di preghiera: questo va bene, ma dobbiamo fare di più; assumere uno stile cristiano vuol dire crescere nella familiarità con il Signore e nello spirito del Vangelo, perché esso possa permeare tutto ciò che facciamo e la nostra azione abbia lo stile di Cristo e lo renda presente nel mondo. In particolare, a fronte di visioni culturali che rischiano di annullare la bellezza della dignità umana e di lacerare la società, vi invito a coltivare ‘un nuovo sogno di fraternità e di amicizia sociale che non si limiti alle parole’ (Lett. enc. Fratelli tutti, 6). È il sogno di San Francesco di Assisi e di tanti altri santi, di tanti cristiani, di tanti credenti di ogni fede. Fratelli e sorelle, sia anche il vostro sogno”.

author: Arnaud Paillard
title: Cette start-up française réinvente la transmission vélo sans chaine
text: Unicy, un vent de changement pour la transmission vélo souffle depuis la Bretagne L'entreprise française Unicy tente de s'imposer dans le monde sans pitié ("Daaaallllaaaasss") de la transmission vélo, en proposant une solution venue du passé : des cardans, conçus pour être fabriqués en France. Une solution acatène vendue comme "robuste, simple d'utilisation et adaptée à tous les usages du cycliste" ; du vélo cycliste sur route au randonneur. Vélo acatène : remettre le cardan au goût du jour Au commencement de l'aventure, un constat. Le constat que la France ne produit quasiment plus d'équipements pour vélo. Résultat : au plus fort de la crise sanitaire, en 2020, les délais pour obtenir un vélo neuf se sont allongés de façon exponentielle. En cause, rappelez-vous, le fournisseur Shimano (entre autres), qui avait toutes les peines du monde à livrer ses commandes à temps. Ce constat pousse les fondateurs d'Unicy – Johan Daniel, Léonard Dabin et Jean-Marie le Corre – à chercher une solution pour fabriquer des transmissions vélo en France. Le premier, travaillant alors pour un magasin de vélos, a vu de près la crise des composants cycles en 2020. Les deux autres sont passés respectivement par l'industrie aéronautique et automobile. Les trois ont moins de 76 ans d'âge cumulé. La solution se porte rapidement sur le cardan, plus facile à fabriquer en France avec le tissu industriel existant. Une transmission simple Pour ceux qui n'ont pas fait de mécanique ou qui ne sont pas des geeks de la transmission, une transmission par cardan – dites acatène (sans chaine) – fonctionne grâce à deux engrenages, l'un dans le boîtier de pédalier et l'autre au niveau du moyeu arrière. Un arbre de transmission les relie. Un arbre qui permet donc de faire tourner les roues quand on actionne les pédales. Simple, basique. Pour un vélo, les avantages du cardan sont nombreux : plus grande longévité, entretien simplifié (les pièces ne sont pas à l'air libre), moins de risques de salissure. Les inconvénients également. Le système est plus lourd et n'est compatible qu'avec un système de vitesses dans le moyeu, de type Nexus, et le rendement n'était pas incroyable. Ajoutez à cela des problèmes de fiabilité, si le cardan n'était pas ajusté au millimètre. Lever les obstacles Unicy promet de lever tous ces obstacles. "La transmission par cardan existe depuis très longtemps, mais elle n'était pas adaptée aux nouveaux usages. Notamment aux vélos à assistance électrique et aux vélos cargo.", explique Jean-Marie le Corre. La transmission à cardan proposé par Unicy se veut plus simple que le modèle existant, que l'on peut trouver sur certains types de vélo. Les plus Bordelais d'entre vous se souviendront que la première version du [Vcub](https://weelz.ouest-france.fr/tag/vcub/), le vélo en libre-service local, était équipé d'une transmission à cardan. Le rayon dans l'engrenage La force du composant proposé par Unicy c'est qu'il ne nécessite pas la conception d'un cadre adapté pour être monté. "Notre solution s'installe sur des points de fixation connus, notamment sur le boîtier de pédalier. La contrainte principale est que la barre droite du triangle arrière doit être un peu surélevée pour laisser passer l'arbre. Mais nous sommes parvenus à monter notre cardan sur des vélos conçus pour être équipés d'une courroie, qui ont cette barre droite un peu décalée pour faciliter le montage de la courroie", poursuit Jean-Marie le Corre. Pour augmenter la performance de la transmission par cardan, Unicy a également fait breveté une nouvelle forme d'engrenages. "Nous avons dû revoir notre système de dentures pour que, quand la personne pédale, il y ait un maximum de surface d'appui pour améliorer la performance de la transmission. Ce nouveau système d'engrenages est plus facile à fabriquer. Il est également plus aisé à installer sur le vélo, car on peut se permettre d'avoir un peu de jeu sans perdre en performance", poursuit le jeune directeur général. Relever le défi de la transmission vélo Made in France L'entreprise, implantée à Vannes, s'est affiliée au [projet CYGO](https://weelz.ouest-france.fr/bycygo-une-aventure-electrique-pour-un-velo-100-pour-cent-grand-ouest/) (L'Union des Entreprises du Cycle Grand Ouest). Elle fabrique ses cardans au sein d'un réseau d'usineurs autour de Nantes, afin de produire localement. "Nos processus de fabrication sont compétitifs pour produire en France. Si l'on maîtrise bien ces processus, en maîtrisant le coût de la main d'œuvre, on arrive à des coûts compétitifs par rapport à des composants fabriqués en Asie.", assure encore Jean-Marie le Corre. Unicy boucle actuellement une levée de fonds pour passer le cap de l'industrialisation. Plusieurs prototypes sont d'ores-et-déjà fonctionnels, et sont encours d'intégration par plusieurs fabricants. Une première pré-série devrait voir le jour à la fin de 2025. Alors, à vos cardans ! Plus d'informations sur [le site officiel](https://www.unicy.fr/). Vous avez aimé cet article ? N'hésitez-pas à [vous abonner à notre newsletter](https://weelz.ouest-france.fr/newsletter-velo/). Vous pouvez aussi nous ajouter en favoris directement dans [Google News](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMJ3Eugswqt_RAw?hl=fr&gl=FR&ceid=FR%3Afr). Et si vous voulez approfondir votre vélo culture, nous décortiquons l'actu vélo dans cette autre newsletter, [Weelz! Décrypte](https://decrypte.weelz.fr/). Une question, une remarque ? [Contactez-nous](https://weelz.ouest-france.fr/contacter-weelz/).

author: Mitchell Armentrout
title: Flu, COVID and RSV on the rise in Cook County heading into 2024
text: Ring in the new year with vaccines, experts urge as COVID, flu cases rise in Cook County Chicago hospitals were admitting about 30 COVID patients per day as of Christmas Eve, a 13% rise from the previous week. Cook County residents should resolve to get vaccinated against COVID-19 and influenza — and they shouldn’t wait until the new year to do it, experts say. Flu cases especially are sending more people to hospitals as winter temperatures plummet, families gather for the holidays and another brutal season of respiratory illness bears down on Chicago, according to Dr. Rachel Rubin, senior medical officer at the Cook County Department of Public Health. “What we’re seeing spreading the fastest is influenza, but both COVID and flu cases are increasing,” Rubin said Thursday. “Flu is beginning to overtake COVID for emergency room visits.” Add in a seasonal uptick in RSV — another respiratory virus packing a serious punch for vulnerable populations — and thousands of Illinoisans are facing a miserable start to 2024. Although upwards of 40% of eligible residents have gotten a flu shot, only about 12% in Cook County have raised a sleeve for the latest COVID booster that was rolled out in September — an “abysmally low” rate, Rubin lamented. “People need to get vaccinated. It doesn’t prevent all cases, but it prevents you from getting serious illness and ending up in the hospital,” Rubin said. And, perhaps most importantly, experts urge residents to get those COVID and flu vaccines, which can be administered at the same time. The Illinois Department of Public Health reported 1,225 new COVID hospitalizations in the week ending Dec. 14, a 22% jump from the previous week. Chicago hospitals were admitting about 30 COVID patients per day as of Christmas Eve, a 13% rise from the previous week, according to the city Department of Public Health. They’ve jumped 40% across Cook County since the beginning of November. Half of all Illinois counties are at a medium or high level of COVID hospitalizations under metrics set by the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. None of those counties is in the metro area, but Rubin said she anticipates Cook County soon will hit an elevated level. Illinois Public Health Director Dr. Sameer Vohra has advised hospitals to reinstate masking policies in areas with higher transmission, which, for now, are mostly in the southern and central parts of the state. “With the alarming rise in respiratory viruses we are seeing across the state and the country, IDPH is recommending healthcare facilities take precautions to reduce the spread of these viruses and protect their patients, staffs and visitors,” Vohra said in a statement. While COVID and RSV hospital admissions are showing signs of plateauing at the statewide level, flu admissions are still trending upward, [state data](https://dph.illinois.gov/topics-services/diseases-and-conditions/respiratory-disease/surveillance/respiratory-disease-report.html) shows. And while specific Cook County data on flu cases wasn’t readily available, the same pattern is playing out at the county level, Rubin said — and all the more reason to ring in the new year with the pandemic habits of old. “Think about wearing a mask at your New Year’s gatherings. Wash your hands. Take a COVID test and stay at home if you feel sick,” Rubin said. The situation still isn’t anywhere near as bad as it was earlier in the pandemic, or even this time last year, but Rubin called masking “the prudent thing to do” in crowded grocery stores and anywhere else you might end up breathing on other people. “It’s to protect others who might be more vulnerable to severe complications.” More than 41,000 Illinoisans have died of COVID since March 2020. COVID and flu shots are recommended for everyone six months or older. RSV vaccines are also available for people 60 or older, as well as infants, young children and pregnant women. For help finding a shot, visit [boostupcookcounty.com](http://www.boostupcookcounty.com).

organizations.name: cook county department of public health

author: Roberto Aguilar Grimaldo
title: En Tamaulipas, liberan a 6 ejemplares de animales a la vida silvestre; hay búhos, linces, ocelotes y una osa | El Universal
text:
Ciudad Victoria.- Una osezna, dos búhos, dos linces, y un ocelote, fueron liberados a la vida silvestre , por personal de la Comisión de Parques y Biodiversidad de Tamaulipas (CPBT). El vocal de la Comisión, Eduardo Rocha Orozco , explicó que son ejemplares que han llegado al zoológico Tamatán por diversas circunstancias, en su gran mayoría por reportes ciudadanos.
Los animales liberados este 3 de octubre de 2024, se encontraban en el zoológico de Tamatán. Foto: Especial Lee también Trasladan a dos cachorros de jaguar a la Biósfera El Cielo en Tamaulipas; se trata de un hembra y un macho
“Son especies a las que se les brindó la atención por el equipo de veterinaria y un espacio en el recinto de familia faunística hasta su total recuperación, por lo que ya pueden ser devueltos a su hábitat”, expresó.
Agregó que entre los ejemplares liberados, “está la osezna que se encontró en el cementerio de Padilla con 5 meses de edad, se recuperó, ya que presentaba desnutrición, garrapatas y estaba muy débil, así como dos búhos; dos linces y un ocelote también recibieron la atención”.
Liberan a 6 ejemplares de animales a la vida silvestre en Tamaulipas este 3 de octubre de 2024. Foto: Especial Éstas acciones se realizaron con la presencia del personal de la Procuraduria Federal de Protección al Ambiente (PROFEPA) y el equipo de veterinaria del Zoológico Tamatán de Ciudad Victoria.
Lanzan convocatoria para que tamaulipecos elijan nombre de jirafa macho; nació en el zoológico Tamatán hace casi 3 meses
Únete a nuestro canal ¡EL UNIVERSAL ya está en Whatsapp!, desde tu dispositivo móvil entérate de las noticias más relevantes del día, artículos de opinión, entretenimiento, tendencias y más.

author: MENAFN
title: Kerala: Over 1.5 Lakh People Visit Idukki During Christmas Celebrations | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - AsiaNet News) Idukki: More than 1.5 lakh people visited various tourist spots in Idukki in the last six days. The tourists flocked to Idukki to celebrate the Christmas-New Year holidays. Most of the people visited Vagamon and Munnar this year.
More than 10,000 people visit various spots daily. Vagamon, Thekkady, Munnar, Idukki, and Ramakalmedu are crowded with tourists. In the last six days, over 150,000 people visited nine DTPC centers. Thekkady saw over 10,000 visitors, while Iravikulam had more than 12,000. Popular tourist spots like Munnar Botanical Garden, Panchalimedu, Ramakalmedu, and Sreenarayanapuram are also seeing a significant influx of tourists this season.
Vagamon's pine forest and Mottakunnu were bustling with tourists, drawing crowds with both natural beauty and thrilling adventure activities. Over the past five days, a whopping 69,000 visitors have explored the scenic charm of Vagamon. A constant stream of visitors is drawn to the glass bridge, which has gained popularity. As the New Year approaches, hotels and resorts are fully booked, with visitors securing accommodations through the first week of January to revel in the festive celebrations amid Vagamon's picturesque landscapes.
Meanwhile, Kerala Forest Development Corporation has organized a flower show for tourists traveling to Vagamon this New Year. The arrangement showcases hundreds of plant species, including succulents, creepers, orchids, anthuriums, and aquatic plants. The landscape is adorned with blooming chrysanthemums and roses, creating a diverse and visually stunning display. This festival not only celebrates the vibrant colors of flowers but also emphasizes the importance of maintaining the ecological integrity of the region.
The flower show is a new experience for tourists in the coolest climate of December. Apart from the flower show, there is also boating in the lake between the Mottakkunn hills, a playground for children, and a watch tower built in the traditional way to enjoy the beauty of Vagamon from a height. There is also a facility to buy favorite plants and other items.

author: Newsroom Infobae
title: Muere, con 30 años de edad, un delfín del acuario de Miami
text:
Miami, 28 dic (EFE).- Sundance, un delfín de 30 años del Acuario de Miami, en el sur de Florida (EEUU), murió como consecuencia de una enfermedad, informó el parque en una publicación en redes sociales.
"Estamos profundamente entristecidos por el fallecimiento de Sundance hoy después de los primeros síntomas de la enfermedad (mostrados) ayer", señaló la noche del miércoles el acuario de esta ciudad del sureste de Florida en un publicación en X (antes Twitter).
Las causas exactas del deceso del mamífero no han sido dadas a conocer y se conocerán una vez esté completada la necropsia, según han señalado portavoces del parque.
El delfín protagonizó un incidente el año pasado, cuando durante una actuación ante el público atacó a una entrenadora, luego de que esta de forma accidental arañara la espalda del animal.
La muerte de Sundance se da meses después del deceso de Lolita, la orca que estuvo más de medio siglo en cautiverio en el Miami Seaquarium y por ello fue un tema de polémica entre grupos de defensa de los animales.
El deceso de Lolita, ocurrido el pasado 18 de agosto, se debió a una "progresión de múltiples afecciones crónicas", incluidas enfermedades renales y neumonía, según reveló la necropsia practicada. EFE
lce/laa

author: РИА Новости
title: Директор НИИ морфологии человека Михалева: герпес 4 типа вызывает ряд опухолей - Рамблер/здоровье
text:
Вирус Эпштейна-Барр или герпес-вирус 4-го типа встречается у 95% взрослого населения в мире в виде бессимптомных и стертых форм инфекции. Он связан с рядом злокачественных новообразований, рассказала «Газете.Ru» директор НИИ морфологии человека им. Авцына ФГБНУ «РНЦХ им. академика Б.В. Петровского», главный научный сотрудник референс-центра инфекционной и вирусной онкопатологии, член-корреспондент РАН Людмила Михалева. © РИА Новости
«Вирус связан с неходжкинской лимфомой, включая лимфому Беркитта, первичной церебральной лимфомой, лимфомой Ходжкина (лимфогранулематозом), носоглоточной карциномой, карциномой желудка; с аутоиммунными заболеваниями, например, системной красной волчанкой. Есть сведения о роли инфекции в развитии антифосфолипидного синдрома как причины невынашивания беременности. Лечение этих заболеваний проводится согласно разработанным протоколам», — рассказала врач. Продолжение истории после рекламы Также рак может вызывать Т-лимфотропный вирус человека. Это ретровирус, вызывающий хроническую пожизненную инфекцию у человека. Приводит к общему снижению иммунитета у человека, как следствие — увеличению частоты и тяжести протекания инфекционных заболеваний, а также вызывает прогрессирующее заболевание нервной системы и, конечно, ассоциирован с развитием Т-клеточной лимфомы взрослых.
«Эффективных средств лечения инфицирования Т-лимфотропным вирусом не существует, основное внимание уделяется профилактике его передачи, а терапевтическая помощь направлена на лечение сопутствующих заболеваний. Таким пациентам назначают кортикостероиды и иммуномодуляторы, а также химиотерапию. Риск развития Т-клеточной лимфомы взрослых у инфицированных лиц в течение жизни оценивается на уровне 5%», — заключила врач. Продолжение истории после рекламы Подробнее о том, как микроорганизмы провоцируют рак и часто ли россияне сталкиваются с опухолями, вызванными вирусами, — в интервью Михалевой «Газете.Ru».

author: Kay
title: Jax Taylor Spotted Moving Out of Brittany Cartwright’s Home
text:
Hit the road, Jax! Brittany Cartwright has finally had enough of her estranged husband Jax Taylor . After separating in February, the two have gone back and forth on social media for everyone to see.
While it always appeared to me that Brittany was done done, it seemed less so that Jax got the memo. But now there is no denying where Brittany’s head is at since she officially filed for divorce this week.
Fresh out of rehab for mental health struggles, Jax was spotted moving out of the home The Valley stars bought in 2019.
Moving day for Jax Taylor
View this post on Instagram A post shared by Jax (@mrjaxtaylor)
The father and bar owner was spotted by Daily Mail loading clothes, boxes, and other miscellaneous items into his black pickup truck. He was not wearing his wedding ring.
If it’s one thing that these two have down, it’s timing. Plenty of fans thought that their split announcement was PR for their new show, as it coincided with the show’s premiere. But as the months went on, it was obvious that Brittany meant business.
She spoke out on numerous occasions about their breakup and expressed a bleak outlook on getting back together. Jax on the other hand, played dirty games on social media about what Brittany was doing while being seen with a new lady friend.
At the end of July, it seemed to be too much for Jax, whose rep confirmed he voluntarily checked into rehab for his mental health. The former stars of Vanderpump Rules were already slated to start filming the second season of The Valley. It wasn’t known if Jax would be back in time when the cameras picked up.
He did make it back in time and Brittany made the most of it. Word immediately came that Jax was served his divorce papers on camera .
According to a source, “There’s a lot that has transpired over the past few months that she could not look past. This decision wasn’t made lightly but she feels adamant that it was the right one.”
In the filing, Brittany cited irreconcilable differences and requested primary legal and physical custody of their young son Cruz.
TELL US – WHERE DO YOU THINK JAX IS GOING TO STAY? WILL YOU BE WATCHING SEASON 2 OF THE VALLEY?

author: Ryan Hughes
title: Caliber Public Safety Enhances RMS with New Crash Reporting Tool
text:
Caliber Public Safety Enhances RMS with New Crash Reporting Tool
Ryan HughesUpdated: 04-02-2025 05:40 PM
Caliber Public Safety Unveils Exciting Update to Online RMS
Caliber Public Safety is excited to announce the launch of Online RMS version 11.18.0, marking a significant upgrade that showcases the company's commitment to innovation and operational efficiency. With over 48 enhanced components, this upgrade effectively addresses the needs of public safety professionals, emphasizing the company's philosophy of listening to user feedback.
What's New in Version 11.18.0
One of the standout features of this upgrade is the introduction of a new premium crash reporting solution. This innovative tool aims to streamline and improve the accident reporting process for agencies. Key features include:
Advanced Features for Enhanced Reporting
The new crash reporting tool comes packed with advanced diagramming capabilities that allow for detailed visual reports. Additionally, it integrates state submission requirements to facilitate smooth agency workflows. The customizable screen designer enables agencies to adjust their workflows without engaging in complex coding changes. Moreover, a custom rules validation engine is included to enhance report accuracy and compliance.
Empowering Agencies with New Tools
This new feature puts the power back in the hands of agencies, offering them complete control over their crash reporting processes. Although currently available in certain areas, the company has plans for its expansion across more states in future updates.
Usability Improvements for Better Experience
Along with the premium crash reporting feature, the latest version also includes multiple usability enhancements. Notably, users can now access quick references directly within arrest narratives, minimizing the need to switch between screens and reducing redundant data entry. These upgrades are designed to save valuable time while ensuring accuracy in reporting.
Dr. Tammie Wojcieszak, Executive Vice President at Caliber Public Safety, emphasizes the company's commitment to adapt and innovate based on customer input. She noted, "The 11.18.0 release reflects our drive to deliver meaningful enhancements that increase efficiency and improve reporting accuracy for our clients."
Ongoing Commitment to Partnering with Public Safety
This release is a testament to the ongoing collaboration with customers and Caliber's mission to deliver thoughtful solutions that empower agencies to enhance their service to the community. By prioritizing interoperability and data-sharing in their solutions, Caliber Public Safety positions itself as a leader in the market.
About Caliber Public Safety
Caliber Public Safety specializes in providing Computer-Aided Dispatch, Mobile, and Records Management systems to over 1,000 public safety agencies across North America. The company's clientele includes federal and state law enforcement, local governments, and metropolitan areas. With a deep commitment to customer care, Caliber strives to earn trust and loyalty from its clients. As part of Harris Computer Systems, their promise includes a strong commitment to lifetime software support, ensuring that clients benefit from ongoing product availability and advancements.
Frequently Asked Questions
What is the main feature of the Online RMS version 11.18.0?
The main feature is the new premium crash reporting solution designed to enhance and simplify accident reporting processes.
How many components were updated in this version?
Version 11.18.0 includes updates and enhancements to over 48 components.
What kind of improvements were made for usability?
The usability improvements allow users to access quick references directly within arrest narratives, enhancing efficiency.
Is the new crash reporting feature available nationwide?
Currently, it is available in select areas, with plans for future expansion to additional states.
What industries does Caliber Public Safety serve?
Caliber serves various public safety agencies, including federal and state police, county governments, and metropolitan areas.
